Bishop's Opening, Berlin Defense.
Here NxPf7, KxN, Qf3+ permits white to make back the knight with BxNd5 unless black moves 6 Ke6.  Then Nc3 helps white further develop while putting pressure on black.

Say what?  Nothing protects this bishop from BxBc5.  Archduke notes a fine alternative (and I ought to think of proposing more of these in my annotations) is NxPf6+.  On the other hand, white's beautiful plan (and bishop sacrifice) will be revealed shortly.

:)  The knight ends up trapped, but still a decent trade.
White is in trouble.  KxPf3 means Bg4+ pins the king against the queen.  RxBg4 is not possible because of discovered check by the black queen.  So black ends up with the white queen for a bishop.

NxBb6 was probably better. Black has a lot of power on Pd4.  PxPd4, PxPd4, BxPd4 and the knight is still protecting the bishop while the white knight is about to feed the black king.
